Comment: I actually know a few snowbirds. According to them It gets super hot in the summer time there but they go down to avoid the winter weather. Also the best time to visit, as in general to travel there is always in June. It's not too hot in June, in my opinion, but also right before peak tourist season and even with the humid/hot weather you now have center air/AC units that can keep you cool. Also it's by the beach and has palm trees. I believe that Florida's political climate sucks right now but it does have several good things going for it. Like several big name amusement parks (Disney World, LEGO Land, Universal, etc...), Daytona, Cap Carnival, the Keys, etc ..  Edit  Also if you want to live year round you also have to put up with hurricanes and right now or seems that insurances are dropping high risks areas and Florida seems to one of them.
